content.description:
Start as for

Andromeda

(or

Milky Way

), and move up and left around the corner and top out on the West face of the boulder.
content.location:
Sit start on cobbly jugs under the overhang on the Southwest corner of Astro Boulder. You can also start on

Milky Way

, and climb into this (harder?).

content.description:
Beware loose and sandy rock until this cleans up.

Sit start just to the right of the overhang area. Move up and left through jugs to top out on the right side of the big, ledgy rooftop.
content.location: It is just to the right of the overhang area.

content.description:
Start on the same start holds as for

Astro Monkey

, but immediately move (up and) left. Traverse left through and undercling on some good holds to the start of

Black Hole

. Finish by climbing

Black Hole

.
content.location: Traverse right to left across the North face of Astro Boulder.

content.description: Sit start on obvious good holds under the roof toward the left side of the overhanging NW face of Astro Boulder. Make a long but easy move up to the large hole, then continue up on smaller crimps.
content.location: It is on the left side of the NW face of Astro Boulder and climbs through the huge hole.

content.description: Sit start on good holds at the right side of the NW face of Astro Boulder. Move up left following the blunt arete.
content.location:
It is on the right side of the NW face of Astro Boulder, right of

Black Hole

.

content.description: Sit start on the pebbly ledges, move up and left, then go straight up through steep jugs to the big lip, hero topout.
content.protection: A pad and a spotter for the topout. Don't trust the rock until this is cleaned up.
content.location: This climbs the steep overhang on the Southwest corner of the boulder. The rock is sandy but with traffic could clean up to be really nice. This seems like the most obvious line straight up the steepest part of the overhang.

content.description:
Start on a good pinch, and move left through amazing crimps 'n' up.

This is quite the gem.
